title: Pras Michel's 14-Year Sentence for Political Corruption
summary: Pras Michel, a former member of the Fugees, has been sentenced to 14 years in federal prison after being convicted on multiple charges, including acting as an unregistered foreign agent, witness tampering, and campaign finance violations. The case, prosecuted in Washington DC, revealed that Michel received over $100 million from Malaysian billionaire Jho Low, which was used to influence US politics during the Obama and Trump administrations. Prosecutors argued that Michel engaged in secret lobbying for China and other entities, betraying national interests for financial gain. Despite their recommendation for a life sentence, Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly imposed a 14-year term. Michel's defense plans to appeal, claiming the sentence is disproportionate. The trial featured testimonies from high-profile figures like Leonardo DiCaprio and Jeff Sessions, highlighting the intersection of celebrity, money, and political corruption.
